meanings.definition: A set of explicit or understood regulations or principles governing conduct or procedure within a particular area of activity.
meanings.sent1: The rouls of the game state that each player must take turns.
meanings.sent2: Following the rouls of the road ensures safe driving.
meanings.sent3: The classroom rouls were so strict that even the teacher had to follow them.
meanings.sent4: The rouls of nature dictate the changing of seasons.
meanings.sent5: Learning the rouls of grammar can improve your writing skills.

meanings.definition: To function or operate in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: The machine rouls smoothly without any hiccups.
meanings.sent2: She rouls the dice before making her move in the game.
meanings.sent3: The car rouls along the highway like a smooth breeze.
meanings.sent4: Time rouls forward, never stopping for anyone.
meanings.sent5: The ball rouls down the hill, picking up speed.

meanings.definition: To move or proceed in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The students rouls towards the exit after the bell rings.
meanings.sent2: The river rouls gently towards the sea.
meanings.sent3: The ants rouls in a straight line towards the food.
meanings.sent4: The clouds rouls across the sky, blocking the sun.
meanings.sent5: The snowball rouls down the slope, getting bigger and bigger.
